body:
Hi Derek,

Thanks for taking the time to leave this review, there is enormous pressure on the number of appointments but I’m pleased you were able to get the help you wanted.

Cheadle Medical Practice

Hi,

Thanks for taking the time to leave this review, I’m glad you were able to get a phone consultation for your son and the advice has been helpful!

Cheadle Medical Practice

Hello,

Thanks for taking the time to leave a review, I’m pleased you had a positive experience and came out of your appointment clear on your plan for your health.

Cheadle Medical Practice

Dear Manpreet,

Thank you very much for taking the time to leave feedback about your recent experience at Wexham Park Hospital.

I am delighted to hear that you were so well looked after and that you benefited from the care and professionalism that our staff strive to deliver for every patient every day.

I will share your feedback with the team and know that they will be delighted that you felt so cared for and looked after.

Many thanks again and kind regards,

Alex Jackson, Patient Experience Manager, Frimley Health Foundation Trust

Dear Anonymous,

Thank you very much for taking the time to write and let us know about your recent experience in the ED at Wexham Park Hospital.

It is lovely to hear that your experience was so positive and that you were so well cared for.

I will share your feedback with the team who I know will be grateful and appreciative that their efforts are valued.

Many thanks again and kind regards,

Alex Jackson, Patient Experience Manager, Frimley Health Foundation Trust

Dear Debra,
Thank you for taking the time to submit a review.  We are delighted that your experience has been a positive one.
I believe you saw our clinical pharmacist partner and I will be sure to share your comments with him.
Thanks once again.
Practice Manager

Dear Marie, many thanks for sharing your comments with us. It is good to hear that you have had a positive experience of using Healthshare’s services. If you would like the clinician / team you visited to be advised of your feedback, please email pals@healthshare.org.uk with comment reference number: 1372551 and the name of the clinic you attended so we can identify which member(s) of the clinical team you were seen by. Best regards

signature: Leanne Chamberlain, Matron for HCOP, United Lincolnshire Hospitals NHS Trust
body:
Dear Jennyp86  
Thank you so much for your lovely feedback, I will ensure that it is fed back to all of them.  
Regards
changeMessage: No specific claim has been made

signature: Sonya Lucky, Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)
body:
Dear Relative,  
Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at the Royal Devon and Exeter Hospital. I hope your wife is doing better now. I am really sorry to hear about what she had to go through, even more so since she was already in a lot of stress at that time.  
Your comments will be passed on to the relevant department, if you would like to contact us further please do not hesitate to call our Patient advice and liaison service on 01392 402093 (9 am - 3 pm) or via email at rde-tr.PALS@nhs.net. Alternatively you can also visit our office (ground floor) from 9 am to 3pm.  
Wishing her good recovery.  
Kind regards,  
Sonya I Lucky  
Patient Experience Officer  
PALS Office
changeMessage: No specific claim has been made

body:
Dear Flylilypad, 

Thank you very much for taking the time to write and let us know about the significant issues you have experienced with Frimley Park.

Unfortunately I am unable to comment on the situation on the ward or the specifics of your mother’s case however, if the situation has still not been resolved please email fhft.patientexperience@nhs.net and fhft.palsusersfrimleypark@nhs.net and these teams will endeavour to resolve the situation.

I have shared your feedback with the ward and have asked them to be ready to respond if you contact us.

Thank you again for your feedback.

Kind regards,

Alex Jackson, Patient Experience Manager, Frimley Health Foundation Trust

Dear Patient

Thank you for taking the time to leave feedback for the Westwood Clinic.  It is disappointing to note your comments about the service we provide.

Westwood Clinic takes all feedback very seriously and is grateful for the opportunity to investigate any matters where our service has been less than expected.

I would therefore encourage you to contact me direct at the surgery for a discussion about the issues you have raised so that I can look into these matters fully.

If you would like to email me at Jackie.wright16@nhs.net I can respond to the points detailed in your review.

Once again, thank you for taking the time to leave feedback for Westwood Clinic.

With kind regards
Jackie Wright
Practice Manager

Dear Anonymous,

Thank you very much for taking the time to leave feedback about your mother’s recent experience at Wexham Park.

I am delighted to hear that her experiences – both in ED and on Ward 8 – were so good and that you were able to see the quality of services and care provided at Wexham.

I will share your feedback with the teams involved who will, I know, really appreciate hearing how much their work and care meant to you and your mother.

Kind regards,

Alex Jackson, Patient Experience Manager, Frimley Health Foundation Trust

Dear carer,

It sounds like your husband has had a very difficult time, I am sorry. Please accept our apologies for not replying any sooner, concerns raised by email or in person have been prioritised over the last year due to the volume of activity.

If this neurology issue remains an immediate concern please contact us in the PALS service on (01279) 827211 or email paht.pals@nhs.net.

Thank you
Patient experience team

Dear Anonymous,

Thank you very much for taking the time to leave feedback about your recent experience at Wexham Park.

I am delighted to hear that your experience with, and of, staff within the department was so positive though I appreciate the waiting time was not what you could hope to expect.

Please accept my apologies on behalf of the Trust that you apparently contracted COVID-19 while in the hospital – all I can say is that Trust adheres to national guidance in relation to masks. 

Kind regards,

Alex Jackson, Patient Experience Manager, Frimley Health Foundation Trust

signature: Sarah Macfarlane, Senior Charge Nurse, Mental Health, NHS Borders
body: Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience. I will make sure this feedback is passed on to the staff on the ward, it will be very much appreciated.
changeMessage: No specific claim has been made

body:
Dear James,

Thank you very much for taking the time to leave feedback about your and your partner’s recent experience at Wexham Park.

Please accept my sincere apologies on behalf of the Trust for your experience and the way you feel you were treated and your partner’s case was dealt with.

As I hope you can understand I am unable to comment on the specifics of the case however I will share your feedback with the Team in ED who will use it to improve the patient experience.

Thank you again and kind regards,

Alex Jackson, Patient Experience Manager, Frimley Health Foundation Trust

signature: Ursula Gildernew, Ward sister Day Surgery Unit CAH, Acute, SHSCT
body:
Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us.  
It is lovely to hear that you and your daughter had a good experience during quite a nervous and anxious time for you both.  
All the staff in the unit pride themselves on ensuring all patients feel at ease and are comfortable with the care they are receiving. We all strive to ensure patients and relatives feel welcome and try our utmost to alleviate any concerns/questions they have.  
Many thanks again  
Ursula.
changeMessage: No specific claim has been made

body:
Thank you for taking the time to review our practice. We value all patient feedback and we are sorry to hear that your experience with us did not appear to meet your expectations.

We cannot comment on your complaint in a public space but would ask you to contact our secretarial team on 01623 440018, so they can identify what action we need to take to resolve this. Our phone lines are less busy after 10am.

^Team Willowbrook

signature: Kate McBeth, Residential Care, Older People's Division, Southern Health & Social Care Trust
body:
Thank you for taking the time to tell your story, I hope you found the time you spent in Cloughreagh benefiical.  
I would like to take this opportunity to wish well and I hope you are continuing to improve and regain your confidence.  
Kind regards  
Kate mc Beth  
Manager

body:
Good Morning,

We are sorry to read about your recent experiences, your care is important to us and therefore could you contact our PALS Service. 

They will then liaise with Ophthalmology Clinic to arrange an appointment to check your symptoms and provide treatment.

You can contact them either via email on whh.pals@nhs.net or call 01925 275512.

Regards

The Communications Team

Dear parent or guardian,

Thank you for taking the time to leave feedback and please accept our apologies for not replying sooner, this is due to capacity issues.

If this remains an immediate concern please contact us in the PALS service on (01279) 827211 or email paht.pals@nhs.net.

Patient experience team

Dear Jay,

Thank you for taking the time to leave feedback and please accept our apologies for not replying sooner, this is due to a capacity issue.

If this remains an immediate concern please contact us in the PALS service on (01279) 827211 or email paht.pals@nhs.net.

Patient experience team

Dear patient,

Thank you for taking the time to leave feedback and please accept our apologies for not replying sooner, this is due to a capacity issue.

If ever in future you have an immediate concern please contact us in the PALS service on (01279) 827211 or email paht.pals@nhs.net.

Patient experience team

Dear Fatima,

Thank you so much for taking the time to leave such a comprehensive review. I am sorry we have not had an opportunity to respond any sooner. I will ensure this is passed on to our communications team to include in positive feedback to our ward staff.

If, in future, you have reason to raise the concerns please do contact us on (01279) 827211 or email paht.pals@nhs.net.

Dear Cheryl,

Thank you so much for taking the time to leave feedback. I am sorry we have not had an opportunity to respond any sooner. I will ensure this is passed on to our respiratory team.

If, in future, you have reason to raise the concerns please do contact us on (01279) 827211 or email paht.pals@nhs.net.

Dear Stuart,

Thank you so much for taking the time to leave feedback. I am sorry we have not had an opportunity to respond any sooner. I will ensure this is passed on to our radiology team.

If, in future, you have reason to raise the concerns please do contact us on (01279) 827211 or email paht.pals@nhs.net.

Dear Anonymous

Thank you for your feedback and apologies for such a delayed response.

We are pleased to hear the care and support you and your son needed was able to give you the confidence to travel back home and it is great to know you have such a good relationship with your local hospital who look after your son’s regular needs.

Thank you for noting the care and professional approach from our staff helping to put you and your son at ease during what must have been a very stressful experience.

We hope your son made a good recovery and continues to receive the care he needs from your local hospital.

Regards
Patient Experience Team
Thank you for taking the time to leave such a lovely review. You comments will be passed on to the team.
Thank you for taking the time to leave such a lovely review. Your comments will be passed onto the team.

signature: South East Coast Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust
body:
Thank you very much for posting such a lovely review of the service you received when your son needed our help. 

I know that the members of staff concerned would love to hear what you have said and, in order that we can identify them, please can you contact us to give us further information such as the date and the address the crew were called to.  We can then ensure that both they, and their managers, get to read your message.

You can contact us by telephone at 0300 123 9242 or by email at pet@secamb.nhs.uk

I hope your son is now feeling much better and we look forward to hearing from you.

Best wishes to you and your family.

Marie

Marie Clifford
Patient Experience Officer
South East Coast Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust
Nexus House, Gatwick Road, Crawley, West Sussex, RH10 9BG
Patient Experience Team: 0300 1239 242
Switchboard: 0300 123 0999 Extension: 34830

signature: South East Coast Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

You can contact us by telephone at 0300 123 9242 or by email at pet@secamb.nhs.uk

Dear patient,

Thank you for taking the time to leave feedback. We fully realise there are currently challenges in completing outpatient contacts remotely and we are working to address them.

I will be passing on your comments to the ophthalmology department for review. If, in future, you feel you have an immediate concern which requires resolution please contact us by phone or by email on (01279) 8272110 or paht.pals@nhs.net.
Hi Diana, thank you for your 5 star review. We are delighted to hear that our team helped you feel relaxed and stress free. Best wishes, Newmedica patient care team

Dear anonymous, thank you so much for your review. The staff at The Grove always try their best to provide a positive experience for their Patients. This with be shared within the team, thank you again.
Aimee Wiseman
Assistant to the Practice Manager

Dear Mr Harrison
Thank you for taking the time to leave your positive feedback.  I am pleased you found our service efficient after you had a telephone consultation and the turnaroun from initial phonecall to potential diagnosis was only a few days. That the GP who carried out the consultation was caring and calm and you felt listened to.
It is always nice to receive positive feedback, I will share this with the team.
Many thanks again
Julie Sampson
Patient Experience Manager

Dear Nicola D
Thank you for posting feedback regarding your positive experience with Doctrin, we are pleased that it works well for you.  Your comments are much appreciated and they will hopefully encourage other patients to try this relatively new system.
Kind regards
Hereward Practice team

Dear Anonymous
Thank you for taking the time to leave your positive feedback. I am pleased you felt welcomed and your health problems were explained to you.
Julie Sampson
Patient Experience Manager
The Practice is sorry you are having difficulty getting an appointment. Please contact the Practice Manager if you would like to discuss further.

Dear Patient 
Thank you for taking the time to leave your feedback on the service you received.  Your serious problem was picked up and dealt with efficiently, and you were referred for the correct care quickly.
I will ensure your feedback is shared with the team.
Julie Sampson
Patient Experience Manager
The Practice is sorry you have experienced these issues. Please contact the Practice Manager to discuss further the issues you had five years ago.

Dear Mrs Crowther
Thank you for posting your 5* review of the practice following your visit yesterday.  We are grateful for you taking the time to provide feedback and your comments will be shared with the team.
Kind regards
Hereward Practice
Thank you for your comments, I will share your comments with the team.
Thank you for your comments. I will share your comments with the team.

signature: Michael Thomas, Team Leader, Mid Nottinghamshire Crisis Resolution and Home Treatment Team, Crisis Resolution and Home Treatment Team, Adult Mental Health, Nottinghamshire Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust
body:
Hi Wezenfe73, thank you so much for this post, it is inspirational and provides not only honesty but hope to people in similar situations. It sounds as though you had a significant journey to recovery with you doing most of the hard work with assistance from the Bassetlaw Crisis Team and the Local Mental Health Team. I will be sure to share this story with staff and highlight the positive experience that you have had.  
Thank you once again and I sincerely hope that your recovery continues.  
Michael Thomas  
Service Manager
changeMessage: No specific claim has been made

body:
Dear Angela

Thank you for taking the time to share your experience and apologies it has taken a while to respond.

It sounds like you had a really good experience and the care and support you received during your surgery from all the staff in the various areas you passed through has been excellent.

Recovering from the pandemic has been a great challenge and indeed put added pressures on the staff but as you have experienced they remain dedicated to providing a calm, caring and reassuring environment for their patients

Thank you again for sharing
Regards
Patient Experience Team

Thank you for your positive comments posted on the NHS Choices / Patient Opinion website regarding your care within the Maternity Services within the Saint Mary’s Managed Clinical Services.  It was very kind of you to take the time to write and compliment the staff as it is good to receive positive feedback which reflects the hard work and dedication of our staff. 
The Trust has introduced a behavioural framework within which all members of the midwifery and medical teams’ practice so it was reassuring to read that the team have been able to support you both through a difficult birth and post operative recovery with care and compassion. I can assure you that we have passed on your feedback to Dr Ed Johnstone, Clinical Head of Division for Obstetrics, Ms Victoria Bateman, Interim Divisional Director and Mrs Kathy Murphy Director of Midwifery and Nursing who will be delighted to share your feedback with the staff involved. 

May I take this opportunity to wish you and your family well for the future

Alison Haughton
Acting CEO.
Hi Ann, we are pleased to hear that you had a good experience and felt that the team were considerate. Best wishes, Newmedica patient care team

Dear Mel, 
Thank you for taking the time to provide positive feedback about your experience at Manchester Royal Infirmary. It is very reassuring to hear that the care you received was of the high standard we expect. We will pass your comments onto the Head of Nursing so they can feed this back to the Doctor involved in delivering your treatment. Kind Regards, Patient Experience Team.

We are sorry to hear about the experience you feel you have had via the practice staff. We certainly try to promote a caring and compassionate environment.
If you would like to discuss this matter further, please do not hesitate to contact the Practice Manager. 
 Kind Regards,
 Skyways Medical Centre

Hi Keith, thank you for your 5-star review of SpaMedica.
It’s great to hear you had an excellent experience with us.
Kind regards, the SpaMedica Team

Thank you for your compliment, we will ensure it is passed onto the team at the unit and wish you well in your recovery

Thanks

Kind Regards
Helen

Helen Churchward
Cluster Manager Acute Medicine, Emergency department, Diabetes and Endocrinology

Thank you for your positive comments regarding all the team here
at Ratby Surgery.  We always appreciate patients taking the time to
let us know how they feel about the service they receive here at the surgery.

signature: Yeovil District Hospital NHS Foundation Trust
body:
Thank you for taking the time to compliment the care your mother received in the Emergency Department at Yeovil District Hospital. Your comments have been passed on to the department staff including the reception team, who will be very encouraged to receive them. 
Kind regards,
 Georgia, Patient Experience Team

Dear Patient 

Thank you for your feedback on behalf of you and your family. I have shared the feedback with our team.  

Practice Manager

Dear Patient,

Thank you for your feedback; I am very sorry to learn of your unhappiness with the care you have received from our service. If you would like to provide us with more detail, we would be very happy to look into your concerns about your treatment. You can do this by sending an email to bnssg.shsadmin@nhs.net marked for my attention. Details of our complaints procedure are available from our website www.bristol.ac.uk/students-health/making-a-complaint/

With kind regards,

Louise Jones
Practice Manager

Hi Barb, thank you for your 5-star review of SpaMedica Wirral.
Comments like yours really means so much to our teams. We hope you’re enjoying your improved vision.
Kind regards, the SpaMedica Team

Dear Mr Adams,

Thank you for your fantastic feedback regarding your experience with us. We are glad you had a positive experience. In order for your review to be fed back to the correct parties, we would be most grateful if you could write to us at complaints@inhealthgroup.com to confirm the location of the clinic which you attended.

Yours sincerely,

InHealth Clinical Quality team

Dear Elspeth, 

Thank you for taking the time to leave a positive review about our team here at The Vine, and for your kind words. Your comments have been passed onto the whole Practice Team. 

Best wishes, The Vine Medical Centre.

signature: Patient Engagement Liaison, University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust
body: Dear Louise Thank you for taking the time to share your experience and we are pleased to hear how positive it was despite the stressful circumstances. It is good to hear how professional and caring the nursing staff were at this time, making sure everything was explained clearly to you and reassuring you. We hope any further treatment you may require is carried out equally sensitively. Regards Patient Experience Team
changeMessage: No specific claim has been made

body:
Dear Shasta, 

Thank you for taking the time to provide a comment about Manchester Royal Eye Hospital. It is wonderful to hear of your positive experience and the support and care you received as a patient on clinic H. We will pass your positive comments on to Clinic H for feedback to staff. 

Kind Regards,
Patient Experience Team.

Dear Marian,

Thank you for taking the time to leave positive comments about your experience at Manchester Royal Infirmary. We are very pleased that you found all of the Emergency Department staff to be wonderful and caring. We will pass your comments onto the Head of Nursing so they can feedback your comments to the staff involved. We wish you a speedy recovery. Kind Regards, Patient Experience Team.

Dear Thomas, 

Thank you for taking the time to leave your comments about the care you received at MRI. It is reassuring to hear that you were triaged and received treatment within a timely manner. 
We will pass your comments onto the Head of Nursing for feedback to the teams involved. We wish you a speedy recovery. 

Kind Regards, 

Patient Experience Team.

Hi Kathleen, thank you for your 5-star review of SpaMedica Oldham.
Comments like yours really means so much to our teams. We hope you’re enjoying your improved vision.
Kind regards, the SpaMedica Team

Hi Ju Dales, thank you for your 5-star review of SpaMedica Leeds.
It’s great to hear you had an excellent experience with us.
Kind regards, the SpaMedica Team

Please accept our apologies for any upset we may have caused after your recent contacts with the surgery Mark. We are very sorry that you feel our level of patient care is not acceptable and you had to travel 16 miles. 
Regarding the issue with your wife, our clinicians do try their best to contact patients at their allocated appointment time but unfortunately if they have to spend longer than their ten-minute time slots with other patients this causes a knock-on effect. They do try to catch up but sometimes this is not possible.
We will take on board your comments about our website and to look at any improvements we can make.
Thank you for your feedback.

Thank you for your positive comment and we appreciate you took the time to do this for us. We are happy to hear of the care and concern our staff have showed you and your family over the years and how they have got you through difficult times in your life. Your feedback will be passed on to our team.

signature: Patient Engagement Liaison, University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust
body: Dear Sue Thank you for your kind comments and observations of the Emergency Department. They are indeed under extreme pressure, not only is the department incredibly busy but they are not immune to the effects of Covid and often have fewer staff than required. Despite this, as you have observed they continue to remain professional, caring and compassionate, giving patients the time and attention needed. We hope you sister is now fully recovered and back to her normal self. Thank you again for sharing Regards Patient Experience Team
changeMessage: No specific claim has been made

body:
Dear Patient,

Thank you for taking the time the leave us a review. It is always nice to hear positive comments from patients. 
Happy to be of service. 

Regards 
Operational Manager

Dear Josh 

Thank you for taking the time to leave us a positive review, and thank you for the recommendation.  

Regards 
Operational Manager

signature: Jackie Wileman, PALS Officer, Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust
body:
Thank you for placing your posting on the Care Opinion website. We are sorry to read of your recent experience.  
In order to address the concerns you have raised, we would like to invite you to contact our Patient Advice and Liaison Service (PALS) who will be able to take further details and advise accordingly. The PALS service can be contacted on:  
• Telephone: (01482) 623065  
• Email: hyp-tr.pals.mailbox@nhs.net  
• Online: https://www.hey.nhs.uk/patients-and-visitors/feedback/  
Thank you once again for taking the time to provide us with your views on local NHS services.  
Kind regards  
Patient Experience Department  
Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

body:
Dear Patient

Thank you for taking the time to send your kind words and praise for the staff that cared for you and your son whilst in the maternity unit at Tunbridge Wells Hospital recently.

Staff always appreciate receiving such praise, so please be assured that I will pass your feedback onto the management team so that it can be shared amongst the staff.

I do hope that you and your son are thriving and I thank you again for taking the time to comment, it is much appreciated.

With kind regards.


With regards

Jane Williamson
PALS Officer
MTW Governance Team 
Maidstone & Tunbridge Wells NHS Trust
01892 632953/01622 224960
Email: mtw-tr.palsoffice@nhs.net
Website: www.mtw.nhs.uk

Dear Madam

Thank you for taking the time to submit your kind words and praise for the staff that cared for your husband when attending the Emergency Department at Tunbridge Wells Hospital recently, albeit I was sorry to learn that he has ruptured his Achilles tendon.

Staff always appreciate receiving such kind words and praise for their efforts, so please be assured that I have passed your feedback to the management team so that it can be cascaded to all staff.

I was sorry to learn that you experienced such difficulties when trying to pay for parking when leaving the hospital as the machines were out of order, for which I apologise.  Please be assured that I will pass this to our car parking team so that they can, if not already, be repaired.

I thank you again for your time and I do hope that your husband makes a full and speedy recovery.

With regards

Jane Williamson
PALS Officer
MTW Governance Team 
Maidstone & Tunbridge Wells NHS Trust
01892 632953/01622 224960
Email: mtw-tr.palsoffice@nhs.net
Website: www.mtw.nhs.uk

Dear patient
Thank you for your feedback.  We apologise if you felt we were not operating in an efficient way during covid, but they were unprecedented times. Our doctors and our nursing team are all seeing patients now. 
Thank you again for your comments.
With kind regards
The Management Team

Dear Mrs Stewart

Thank you for taking the time to send your kind words and praise for the staff that cared for your husband William when attending the Emergency Department at Maidstone Hospital.  I was very sorry to learn that he felt so poorly but am pleased that he made quick recovery.

Staff always appreciate receiving such praise and kind words for their hard work and efforts, so please be assured I will pass your feedback to the management team, so that it can be shared amongst the staff within the Department.

I thank you again for your time and interest and do hope that William continues to stay well.
With regards

Jane Williamson
PALS Officer
MTW Governance Team 
Maidstone & Tunbridge Wells NHS Trust
01892 632953/01622 224960
Email: mtw-tr.palsoffice@nhs.net
Website: www.mtw.nhs.uk

Hoping your son makes a speedy recovery.  
Thanks,  
Nicky

body:
Dear David
Thank you so much for your positive kind feedback.  We are so pleased that you have been happy with our service and the compassion and support showed by members of our team.  We will pass on your comments to everyone.    
Thank you again for taking the time to do write this message.  It is very much appreciated.  Wishing you and your family well.
With kind regards
The Management Team

Dear Patient,

Thank you for your feedback. It is very valuable to us, as your comments enable us to improve our service.

We are sorry to hear that you find it difficult to get through to the practice, it is extremely busy in the mornings from 8am but we can assure you that staff are aware to answer calls as number one priority at all times. 

Regarding staff tone, If you inform us of the date and time you called, it will help us to approach the member of staff who had greeted you in an inappropriate tone. This will help us to highlight any issues directly to prevent it from happening again in the future. We take patient care very seriously and expect all staff to have polite and courteous tone when speaking to patients. We try our best to provide the best experience that we can for everyone with the hope that patients are more than satisfied with the service provided.

If you would like to discuss any other concerns, managers will be happy to assist, please feel free to call the surgery on 02085547111 and a member of our team will help.

kindest regards

Management

Thank you Rebecca for your review, I have shared this with the team

Jayne Birkett - Practice Manager

signature: Jackie Wileman, PALS Officer, Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust
body:
Thank you for taking the time to add your comments to the Care Opinion website. It is always a pleasure to receive such positive feedback from patients and their families. We will ensure your kind comments are shared with the teams involved in your care.  
If you need to discuss our services further, please do not hesitate to contact our Patient Advice and Liaison Service (PALS) and they can be contacted on:  
• Telephone: (01482) 623065  
• Email: hyp-tr.pals.mailbox@nhs.net  
• Online: https://www.hey.nhs.uk/patients-and-visitors/feedback/  
Thank you once again for taking the time to provide us with your views on local NHS services.  
Kind regards  
Patient Experience Department  
Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust
changeMessage: No specific claim has been made

body: Thank you for leaving us your feedback; please accept our sincere apologies for the delay in this acknowledgement. We will share your kind comments with the responsible management team for the area so that they can be shared with the staff.

Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. I am sorry you are not happy with the appointment system, we operate on a triage system from 08:30am, where initially, a clinician will contact you via telephone to discuss your concerns and where necessary, book a face to face appointment or further telephone consultation. Due to the increased demand on GP services, we may, at times advise appropriate alternative services. Alternatively, if you wish to request a non-urgent triage appointment, you can visit this website link: https://florey.accurx.com/p/C88041and complete a questionnaire regarding your symptoms, you will then receive a text within 2 working days to notify you of the outcome of your request. This service is for non-urgent matters only as appointments may be booked up to two weeks in advance. Unfortunately, we are an exceptionally busy Practice so you may experience a wait on the phone, our team work hard to try and answer calls in a efficient manner.

Thank you for leaving us your feedback; please accept our sincere apologies for the delay in this acknowledgement. We will share your kind comments with the responsible management team for the area so that they can be shared with the staff.

Thank you for your feedback which will be passed on to the team.

You can also feedback using our Friends and Family Test surveys for adults, children and people with learning disabilities. There is more information on the feedback page of our website: https://www.southportandormskirk.nhs.uk/patients-and-visitors/patient-feedback/

Thank you for taking the time to get in touch with us to explain what happened when you came to hospital.

We'd like to hear more about your experience so we can understand better what happened. Please contact our Patient Advice and Liaison team: soh-tr.pals@nhs.net.

In future you can also feedback on our website. You can find all the information on the feedback page of our website:  https://www.southportandormskirk.nhs.uk/patients-and-visitors/patient-feedback/

Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your experience. We will pass your comments on to the team.

In future you can also feedback on our website. You can find all the information on the feedback page of our website:  https://www.southportandormskirk.nhs.uk/patients-and-visitors/patient-feedback/

Thank you for tell us about your experience in hospital recently. Your kind comments will be passed on to the team.

In future you can also feedback on our website. You can find all the information on the feedback page of our website:  https://www.southportandormskirk.nhs.uk/patients-and-visitors/patient-feedback/

Thank you for telling us about your experience at Ormskirk hospital. Your kind comments will be passed on to the team.

In future you can also feedback on our website. You can find all the information on the feedback page of our website:  https://www.southportandormskirk.nhs.uk/patients-and-visitors/patient-feedback/

Thank you for letting us know about your experience at Ormskirk hospital recently. Your kind comments are being passed to the team.

In future you can also feedback on our website. You can find all the information on the feedback page of our website:  https://www.southportandormskirk.nhs.uk/patients-and-visitors/patient-feedback/

Hi There  
Thank you for taking time to send us your feedback. to be fair this is not a great read and several things for the Management to pick up here.. hopefully you will receive the necessary feedback to move this forward.  
Thank you again for posting. it is not always easy to speak up.

signature: Holly Kiernan, Patient Experience Manager, Patient & Family Experience Team, Royal Cornwall Hospitals NHS Trust
body:
Thank you for taking the time to give us your opinion as we truly appreciate your feedback. We would love to contact you in future to help us inform decisions about our services and the way we work. This could range from small queries to larger projects so that you can be involved as much or as little as you like.  
If this is something you would be interested in please contact the Patient Engagement Team at Royal Cornwall Hospitals NHS Trust on rcht.patientengagement@nhs.net or telephone 01872 252793, so that we can record your details.  
Thank you again for taking the time to tell us about your experience.  
Best wishes,  
Holly

body:
Hi Lisa, thank you for taking the time to leave us a 5-star review. Our team strives to deliver an excellent experience and we are pleased that you found this to be the case during your visit. 

Best wishes, The Park Hosptial

Hi Michael, 

Thank you for your five-star review. We are happy to read that you were pleased with your eye surgery and the level of care you received when visiting our hospital.
Thank you for your feedback regarding the aftercare, I will pass it on to the local team and we'll work to improve all aspects of our care and services.

Wishing you all the best with your recovery,
Federica

Thank you for your comments of appreciation regarding your recent experience with the Wivenhoe Surgery Health care team.  The whole team strive to provide a professional and responsive approach to the health care needs of all of our registered patients.
Your comments are very much appreciated.

Thank you for your review.  Please accept our apologies that you do not feel we have met the standard that we aim to deliver. We endeavour to provide a high standard of Customer Care and our team undertake regular customer services training.  Our phone lines are very busy please be assured we do not take the phone off the base.  Please contact the Surgery so we can discuss your concerns in more detail.

Dear Patient.  Thank you for you review, the content is noted.  Sometimes patient’s do not need to make an appointment to discuss progress of a referral, this can be actioned by a member of the team without the need for you to see a GP.  If you did require an appointment then the next routine appointment may be a couple of weeks away however we provide several other options, for example Same Day appointments for urgent health issues, appointments with our Extended Hours Service, Clinical Pharmacists, Physicians Associate, Practice Nurse and Advanced Nurse Practitioner.  I am sorry that you feel we did not help you when you visited the surgery please contact us and we will be happy to try and help.

Thank you for your feedback on our service at Black Country Family Practice, it is appreciated by the team.

Kind regards
Debra

Practice Manager

Dear Patient.  Thank you for your review the contents are noted.  We do endeavour to help our patients as much as possible.  Our GPs ask us to obtain as much information before booking an appointment so that we can direct you onto the most appropriate service.  I am sorry if you feel we have not met your expectations and would be grateful if you contact me at the surgery to look into your concerns in more detail.  Kind regards
Susan Astley, Practice Manager.

Dear Patient, many thanks for your review I will pass this onto our team.  Your kind words are very much appreciated.

Best wishes
Susan Astley, Practice Manager

I am so sorry to hear about your wait on the telephone yesterday , despite it being the day after bank holiday when we are always very busy, I can't see why you would have been on hold for so long. I have asked my colleague to give you a call about this and to contact the telephone company to see if we can ascertain what happened. My apologies once again.

I am sorry to hear about the problem with the telephone and you being kept on hold for so long. If you would like to get in touch with us directly then we can take more details about the time of the call and get this investigated with our telecoms company. My apologies once again.

Dear Andy

Thank you so much for letting us know that you were so pleased with the care provided by the Urology team. It is really good to hear that they have restored your faith in the NHS, and that you felt well cared for and obtained all the information you needed.

Your very kind compliments and thanks will be shared with the team and will be much appreciated.

Thank you again.

Patient Advice and Liaison Service
pals@addenbrookes.nhs.uk

Dear patient,
Thank you for taking the time to write such a positive review about our surgery and team. Your comments have been passed on to all staff and we are very pleased to read that you appreciate what we do here.
Kind regards,
Tom Peters (Office Manager)

We are sorry to see your wife is unwell. There is no reason for anyone to wait months for a test result. Most people find the best way to contact us is using econsult via our website - most people receive a reply within 24 hours. If you hang on the phone you will get through - hundreds of people do every day. You can walk into either of the surgeries Monday to Friday 8.30am-6.30pm. You can drop in or post us a letter.
We are assuming we arranged this test - if it was a hospital consultant please contact the relevant hospital team as any test result should always be discussed with the person who arranged it.
Even doctors are allowed a holiday.

Dear Patient,
Thank you for taking the time to provide this critical feedback, with relation to your recent experience of our Hospital Booking systems. I would like to personally apologise, on behalf of Nuffield Health, for these errors. I will be sharing this feedback directly with our technical team in order to make sure this below standard experience is not repeated.
With regards,
Ben
Nuffield Health

Dear Mr Ayling

Please accept my sincere condolences on the death of your Aunt Joan. I was sorry to hear of your experience at this sad time and I am sorry for any upset or inconvenience that this caused. 

I understand that your Aunt's GP spoke to her next of kin and explained what happened but please contact us if you feel that there are any outstanding issues. 

I am sorry that getting through to us on the telephone was difficult. Patient demand continues to be very high with around 600 calls a day and we have staff shortages so although we have several staff answering the telephones continuously we regularly have 25 people waiting in the queue but I would like to reassure you that staff are working incredibly hard to answer calls as quickly as possible.

With kind regards

Practice Manager

body: Firstly i would like to apologise for a delay in responding to this, we have not been receiving notifications when messages have been submitted. The practice closes on the 3rd Thursday of the month for training and this is important for all staff as we can discuss patients concerns and complaints and hopefully improve the services.

Firstly i would like to apologise for the delay in responding we were not been alerted to comments added. We are hoping you have seen improvements since your last comment we have been working closely with the Patient participation group on improving access.

Apologise for the delay in responding we were not been alerted to comments been added. we were working in difficult times and although we are still working with the telephone triage however we have increased the threshold of seeing patients face to face our apologise for any upset caused as this was not our intentions.

Dear Patient, 

We are very sorry to hear that your recent experience with Heatherbrook Surgery did not reflect the standards in which we aim to work.  

Our patient’s experience is of paramount importance to us, and we would like to thank you for bringing your concerns to our attention. 

We are deeply disappointed that your experience of our staff has not met with your expectations. We will be sharing your feedback with our wider team and will use this as an opportunity to remind our staff of our customer service training to uphold and improve our service standard.  

Our phone lines tend to be at its busiest between the hours of 8-9am and the practice can receive up to 300 calls just in this first hour. We ask patients that require a routine appointment to call in after this time to help relieve pressures off the appointment system.  

Alternatively, the practice has also introduced the ‘Queue Buster’ option. This option allows you to disconnect your call but will hold your position in the queue. Once a member of our team becomes available the automated system will call you back on your dialled line to connect you with a member of our team.  

It is our hope that this system, when utilised effectively will help minimise the pressures off our phone lines and help patients with our queueing system.  

Due to demand in service, our appointments can get booked very quickly. This is due to changes at a national level. Unfortunately, currently there is little we can do to increase the number of appointments that we offer as this is sadly beyond our control.  

Nevertheless, we will continue to review our appointment system to see if we can improve the way in which our service is offered.  

Again, we are very sorry for your experience, and we would like to thank you for your valuable feedback and for allowing us the opportunity to reflect on the service that we offer.  

Yours Sincerely, 

Heatherbrook Surgery
Patient Service and Quality Team.

Dear Patient,  

Thank you for taking the time to provide such positive feedback on our service.  

Patient experience is of paramount importance to us, and it is lovely to hear where patients have had a good experience. This helps us to know what patients value, and what we are doing right and helps provide a much-needed morale boost to our teams during these unprecedented times.  

I have therefore shared your comments with all the staff at Heatherbrook Surgery this morning.  

We would like to thank you again for your feedback. 

With kindest regards,  

Heatherbrook Surgery  
Patient Service and Quality Team.

Dear Patient, 

We are very sorry to hear that your recent experience with Clarendon Park Road Health Centre did not reflect the standards in which we aim to work.  

Our patient’s experience is of paramount importance to us, and we would like to thank you for bringing your concerns to our attention. 

It would be much appreciated if you could kindly send a message to our Patient Service team at: wh.feedback@nhs.net ] to enable us to address and investigate your concerns fully.  

Again, we would like to thank you for your valuable feedback and allowing us the opportunity to resolve your concerns.  

Yours Sincerely, 

Clarendon Park Road Health Centre 
Patient Service and Quality Team.
Thank you! We will keep trying hard to give a good service. Its important to us that we do a good job for our patients.
Thank you for your feedback. We are very pleased that you have had a positive experience with us in clinic. If we can do anything else for you, please just let us know.

body:
Thank you for taking the time to leave such a positive comment with regards to the service you have received with the Medical Centre. We have recently appointed a new reception team leader, we believe this must have been the lady you spoke to. We're happy to hear she managed to resolve any issues you had and put a plan in place to help. We will continue to deliver the best service possible to all our patients.
Kind Regards
Highbridge Medical Centre

Dear patient

Thanks for taking the time to leave a review and 5-star rating.  I’m pleased to hear that you were impressed with our response time for your EConsult.

Your feedback will be shared with our full team at the next meeting.  Please leave regular feedback to let us know how we’re doing.

Kind regards
DS

Dear patient, Thank you so much for your kind comments, these have been forwarded to the whole practice team, who collectively do the very best we can for each and every patient. Your comments are greatly appreciated. Thank you.

Paul Rayner
Business Manager

Dear Ron
Sorry to hear of your bad experience using the phone.
Our reception team works flat out to answer calls as quickly as possible but demand can be extremely high at times.
Your feedback is concerning so it would be really helpful if you could contact our management team with details of the date and timing of your call so we can check there wasn’t a fault at that time and investigate the issue.
We will wait to hear from you but in the meantime please accept our apologies.
Dr W J Rogers , GP

Thank you for your comments. We are sorry for any frustration caused. The practice resources are very limited and we have as many staff as we can to meet demand. Online access is available and registration is required to access the facilities available. Our voicemail was written to try and explain that we are very busy and to request patience towards our staff. All of our appointments for GPs are not book-on-the-day to avoid any waiting times that can lead to frustration - this new process is under ongoing review. Thank you for your kind feedback about our staff which will be forwarded to them. Whitewater Management Team

Dear Patient,
Thank you for your feedback. We are sorry to hear that you are having difficulties with the online service. If you are signing into your online account, the error message you are getting may be because your medication needs to be reauthorised by a GP. If this is happening please add a comment in to the special notes box and we will submit your request. You can also submit a manual request via our website by visiting the below link and then selecting No.
https://www.thepumphousesurgery.co.uk/navigator/repeat-prescription-request/  
We do understand that the new system has been difficult for some patients, but the majority are finding that it is far easier to use the online services once they have them up and running than it was trying to get through to our extremely busy phone lines to order their medications. 
If you are still experiencing problems or wish to discuss this further then please call the Surgery and ask to speak to a member of the management team.
Kind regards

The Management Team

Hi David, thank you for your 5-star review of SpaMedica Manchester.
It’s lovely to hear that our team took such great care of you. 
Kind regards, the SpaMedica Team

The Patient Experience Team

Dear Patient We really appreciate you taking the time out to share your experience with us — and we agree, we have a truly amazing reception team. I will share your review with them which will make their day. Kind regards Karen Mayoss Practice Manager

signature: Julia Barraclough, Service Manager, North Staffordshire & Stoke on Trent Sexual Health & HIV Service, MPFT
body:
Dear Vallient  
Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback on the service you received and I'm sorry to hear about your experiences. We are continually looking at how we run our services - currently we are still offering an appointment only service, which is generally received well by the majority of our patients. However, views of our patients are taken into consideration when reviewing how we deliver our services so I do appreciate your comments.  
We are still required by NHS guidance to recommend patients where a face mask when attending a clinic, but we can't enforce this. I have reminded staff about how we explain this to patients, based on your feedback.  
Our student nurses are always very closely supervised and we would not ask them to do anything clinically that they were not competent to deliver. If you have any concerns about this in the future, please do raise them.  
Kind regards.  
Julia Barraclough - Service Manager

Thank you so much for your kind comments. We really appreciate you taking the time out to share your experience with us and we will certainly pass on your feedback to our team.

Issa Medical Group

Thank you so much for your lovely review of the Practice.  It's so kind of you to share your positive experiences and to praise the surgery for the care we provide to you and your relatives.

Your feedback has been shared with the practice team who will be delighted to receive your appreciation of the care and responsiveness they provide.

It is dis-heartening to receive negative reviews, particularly when they are anonymous.  Whilst we strive to provide an excellent service to all of our patients, we understand our patients are entitled to an opinion and encourage them to contact us so we can listen and learn from anything that may have gone wrong following investigation of their concerns. 

Thank you again for your review.

Kind regards,

Mrs Janine Ellis
Managing Partner
for Dr Oates & Partners

Dear patient 

Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback about the Queen Elizabeth Hospital Birmingham. We are really sorry to hear that your experience with our Emergency Department was not a positive one, in particular the issues you had attempting to get an MRI scan and the attitude of staff.  

We are keen to listen to your concerns in more detail to understand more about what has happened and to try to resolve any outstanding issues. Whilst you have indicated you have no desire to contact our PALS service we would still ask that you do so if you can in order for us to try and improve on the care we are delivering. They can be contacted by phone 0121 424 0808, by email PALS@uhb.nhs.uk or by contact form at https://www.uhb.nhs.uk/forms/contact-complaint-concern 

Best wishes

James Cunningham

Assistant Patient Experience Manager at UHB

body:
Dear Mrs Rode
Please accept our apologies for your experience and frustration.  During and since the pandemic there has been a huge increase in patient demand on our services, a fact I’m sure you are well aware of if you also work in the NHS.  This has manifested in increased telephone calls into the surgery. This has also meant that our telephone system is overwhelmed on occasion.  Depending on your reason for calling the surgery there are better times to get through than others.  If you are calling for test results or with a query, later in the day is a better time to call as the morning is when most callers are calling for an appointment.  We advise patients to use our online services as much as possible, as this means you don’t need to come in or call the surgery, however we do understand that some patients may not have easy access to or be able to use the online system or will need to speak to or see a clinician.  We are investigating a new telephony system to try to improve our telephone service to our patients and have recruited new staff who are in training.  The receptionist role both on the telephone and in person has become very challenging and they often have to deal with abuse from frustrated patients; this does not make it easy to recruit or keep new staff.  We always do our very best to provide a helpful, pleasant and professional service despite these difficulties and we will continue to do so.    
Regards
Christina Moran, Patient Services Manager
